response.original_title: Remembering Antietam: The Bloodiest Day in American History
response.overview: Remembering Antietam" explores the legacy of the bloodiest single-day battle in American history and Col. Ezra Carman’s role in documenting and preserving the battlefield where 23,000 soldiers were killed or wounded in twelve hours of combat. This U.S. victory, though costly, gave President Abraham Lincoln the opportunity to issue the preliminary Emancipation Proclamation. With President Lincoln’s bold action, the Civil War's purpose expanded from a fight to preserve the Union to include the struggle to abolish slavery.
response.title: Remembering Antietam: The Bloodiest Day in American History
